meanings.definition: To set a price in advance for something.
meanings.sent1: She always preprices her handmade crafts before selling them at the market.
meanings.sent2: The store preprices all items before putting them on the shelves.
meanings.sent3: The magician preprices his tricks to ensure they are worth the show.
meanings.sent4: The chef preprices the menu items like a conductor orchestrating a symphony.
meanings.sent5: The artist preprices her paintings with care and consideration.

meanings.definition: To determine the price of something before it is sold.
meanings.sent1: Before the auction, they preprice each item to attract bidders.
meanings.sent2: The real estate agent preprices the houses based on market trends.
meanings.sent3: The detective preprices the stolen goods to catch the thief red-handed.
meanings.sent4: The scientist preprices the value of the rare mineral like a treasure hunter.
meanings.sent5: The farmer preprices the crops to ensure a fair profit at the market.
